result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Waleed D Arrweidi

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on November 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

for Joinder of 21CM1479 and 22CM1785 filed by the State

**Reviewed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on 10-31-2022: Stack on next date.**
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on October 5, 2022

THE DEFENDANT HAS POSTED $650.00 CASH BAIL AT THE WAUKESHA COUNTY JAIL.  USE $500.00 CASH BAIL ALREADY ON DEPOSIT.   REFUND THE $150.00 CASH BOND TO THE POSTER.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victims A/witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key. Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victims B & C listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. The Defendant not to physically discipline or utilize any corporal punishment on any child.  Any orders out of the family case in Milwaukee will trump these orders and the Defendant to follow those orders.

1:26 PM Defendant Waleed D Arrweidi in court.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Waleed D Arrweidi.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. Ayman Khatib appeared in person as interpreter and sworn in. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
ARABIC INTERPRETER NEEDED AT NEXT COURT DATE.
INTERPRETER AYMAN KHATIB IS AVAILABLE FOR THE NEXT COURT DATE
Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
